lesson_01.Title: When you come or leave
lesson_01.Info: When we meet our friends we say...
lesson_01.Memo: This is an informal greeting. We say it to friends, family, and acquaintances.

lesson_02.Title: In the morning
lesson_02.Info: In the morning we greet each other with...
lesson_02.Memo: This is a formal greeting but used in informal situations as well. We say "dobro jutro" until about 10 am. "Dobro" means "good", "jutro" is "morning".

lesson_03.Title: In the afternoon
lesson_03.Info: During the day we say to each other...
lesson_03.Memo: This is formal greeting used from about 10 am till 18 pm. "Dan" means "day". Notice that "jutro" was "dobro", and "dan" is "dobar". The reason for that change is the genders in the Croatian language. A day is male and morning is of neutral gender. Evening, in the next lesson is female.

lesson_04.Title: In the evening
lesson_04.Memo: Many Croatian people are confusing word genders, especially for the word evening - "večer", which is in the female gender. So you can often hear "Dobro večer", or "Dobar večer", and no one will give you strange looks if you make the same mistake.

lesson_05.Title: Welcoming
lesson_05.Memo: Notice that "dobrodošli" is one word made of two words "dobro" = "good, well" and "došli" = "come" connected to one, unlike greetings for the morning, day, evening and night "dobro jutro", "dobar dan", etc...

lesson_06.Title: On farewell
lesson_06.Info: When we're leaving people we say...

lesson_07.Title: See you!
lesson_07.Info: To give a notice on farewell that we'll see eachother again we say...
lesson_07.Memo: "Vidimo se" literally means "We see each other"

lesson_08.Title: Being polite
lesson_08.Info: If we want to be polite to other people we ask them how are they...
lesson_08.Memo: Informally, you would use a singular form "Kako si?". If you're asking someone formally or you're asking a group of people, you would use plural form "Kako ste?"

lesson_09.Title: While eating
lesson_09.Info: In a restaurant or a dining room we say...

lesson_10.Title: While drinking
lesson_10.Info: When giving a toast we look each other in the eyes and say...
lesson_10.Memo: Živjeli means "Let's live!". We also say "Nazdravlje!" or "Uzdravlje!". That means "To health!"
